title: User Profile: Dr. Steven Massie
description: Aerosols have a huge impact on climate and human health. Dr. Steven Massie uses remotely-sensed data to better understand these impacts and improve how aerosols are detected by Earth observing satellites.

title: The Sundarbans
description: Image captured on 24 February 2018, by the MODIS instrument, aboard the Aqua satellite.

title: Squeezing Water from Rock
description: Studying modern earthquakes that produce liquefaction can help better interpret the geologic record of liquefaction during past events.

title: User Profile: Dr. Brian Mapes
description: Who uses NASA Earth science data? Dr. Brian Mapes, to study large-scale weather and climate processes.

title: User Profile: Dr. Faisal Hossain
description: For the people of Asia and Southeast Asia, water is integral to their livelihood. Dr. Hossain uses NASA Earth observing data to improve water management and accelerate economic development in these regions.

title: And the Winners Are . . .
description: See who took home top honors in the world’s largest global hackathon.

title: When the Earth Moved Kashmir
description: Science and relief efforts come together in the aftermath of the 2005 Kashmir earthquake.

title: Worldview Snapshots Links to Rapid Response Subsets
description: To assist in the transition from NASA's Rapid Response Subsets, this list of links is provided for users to go to the corresponding area in Worldview Snapshots.

title: Karakoram Mountain Range
description: Image captured on 29 April 2018, by the MODIS instrument, aboard the Terra satellite.

title: Tropical Cyclone Tauktae
description: Image captured on 17 May 2021, by the VIIRS instrument, aboard the joint NASA/NOAA Suomi NPP satellite.

title: Tropical Cyclone Amphan in the Bay of Bengal
description: Image captured on 18 May 2020 at 12:10 UTC, by the AHI instrument, aboard the Himawari-8 satellite.

title: A Kink in the Jet Stream
description: Extreme weather events thousands of miles apart may be linked.

title: NASA Expands Contract with Planet Labs Inc. for Satellite Imagery
description: The contract expansion significantly broadens the availability of Planet imagery distributed by NASA’s Commercial Smallsat Data Acquisition (CSDA) program.

title: Himalaya's Heat Pump
description: Polluted air over Asia is changing patterns in remote mountain ranges.

title: Winter Blooms in the Arabian Sea
description: A tiny organism and its tenants make an unexpected appearance.

title: Measuring the World's Croplands
description: The Global Food Security-support Analysis Data (GFSAD) collection provides detailed maps of agricultural croplands around the world at 30-meter spatial resolution.

title: Nighttime Images Show Changes in Human Activity
description: Nighttime satellite images provide a unique global picture of how human activities are changing on a daily basis. Images from January 19 and February 4, 2020

title: Eight Citizen Science Projects Receive NASA Funding
description: NASA’s Citizen Science for Earth Systems Program (CSESP) announces eight citizen science projects funded through the 2020 NASA Research Opportunities in Space and Earth Sciences (ROSES) solicitation.

title: An Earth System Data Record of Earth's Surface Mass Variations from GRACE and Geodetic Satellites
NASA Announces Winners of 2022 Global Space Apps Challenge
description: Ten teams from around the globe took home top honors in the world’s largest annual hackathon addressing real-world problems on Earth and in space.

title: MOPITT Data Now Available in LANCE
description: Global carbon monoxide data from the MOPITT instrument aboard NASA’s Terra satellite are the newest near real-time products available through the Land, Atmosphere Near real-time Capability for EOS (LANCE).

title: Effects of Emissions on Climate Change
description: Separating human-caused climate change from natural climatic variability.

title: Matter in Motion: Earth's Changing Gravity
description: A new satellite mission sheds light on Earth's gravity field and provides clues about changing sea levels.

title: Crazy Bad Air
description: Open sharing of pollution data helps Chinese netizens brave the politics of murky air.

title: SpaceML: Rise of the Machine (Learning)
description: A global team is using artificial intelligence and machine learning to enable users to search for specific features in satellite imagery available through NASA’s Global Imagery Browse Services (GIBS).

title: Fusing Five Satellite Instruments' Data Into One Dataset: Introducing Terra Fusion
description: Terra Fusion, a new data product and toolkit, allows researchers to combine data from all five Terra instruments into one cohesive dataset.

title: Lake Observations from Citizen Scientists and Satellites
Nighttime Lights
description: Backgrounder on VIIRS day/night band and its applications.

title: Terra: Five Instruments—One Monumental Data Record
description: After more than 20 years in space, the five instruments aboard NASA’s Terra satellite continue their singular achievement of compiling a climate data record of Earth.

title: The Flood Hunters
description: Researchers develop a long-term archive of satellite data that will help hydrologists monitor floods, allow aid agencies to pinpoint flood-prone regions, and provide information for modeling some of the Earth's complex hydrologic cycles.

title: NASA FIRMS Helps Fight Wildland Fires in Near Real-Time
description: NASA’s worldwide Fire Information for Resource Management System (FIRMS) provides vital near real-time tools for managing wildland fires.

title: User Profile: Dr. Thomas A. Herring
description: The Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS) enables the precise location of points on Earth’s surface. For geodesists like Dr. Herring, it also is a key geodetic technique for his studies of surface deformation processes.

title: Rooting Out Rainfall
description: Polar water fuels off-kilter rainfall in the tropics.

title: When the Big Picture is Not Enough
description: A researcher pushes the limits of radar data to monitor small rice fields in the Philippines.
